review_title: Not the best working conditions for not the best pay
pros:
- Tickets to Opera and getting to watch dress rehearsals. 
- Working in such a historic building
- A prestigious company, great professional experience.
cons:
- If you are based in Hampstead offices, the building is shambolic and the office conditions are the worst I have ever experienced: little light, rooms are either too cold or too hot, furniture hasn't been replaced since the 1980s. Makes the whole working experience a bit miserable and dire. 
- Management probably needs a bit of training on how to manage. However, a lot of this is probably down to the fact that everyone is pretty overworked/understaffed. 
-As the company is pretty large and there is a really bad communication ethos, trying to get anything done takes ages and is incredibly frustrating: people not replying to emails, not answering telephones etc. 
- IT systems are dated and almost unusable at this point 
- Pay is quite bad. Apart from free tickets allowance to Operas and discount at the Coliseum bar and shop, there are no staff benefits.

review_title: Opera Good......Everything else is terrible....An attractive black hole.
pros:
Being involved with the Opera.  
What is produced is wonderful, just not profitable.  
The CEO is a nice guy and there are some good characters in there.
cons:
Bad culture, Dishonest people in key areas. Dead weight.
Lack of professionalism.  
Zero processes.  Key man risks everywhere resulting in catastrophic screw ups. 
Couldn't do a competitive commercial deal to save its life.
IT systems are manual and integration is awful.
Bullying and cronyism of the worst order.  
If you have any sense of ethics then avoid like the plague you will not survive or be infected.  shambolic is the most common phrase heard about the place.  
The lunatics are running the assylum.
